IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Thacher School is a coeducational boarding high school (grades 9-12) serving academically talented students who will benefit from a rigorous college preparatory experience. Honor, fairness, kindness and truth are the cornerstones of school life.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Thacher School is a coeducational boarding high school (grades 9-12) serving academically talented students who will benefit from a rigorous college preparatory experience. Honor, fairness, kindness and truth are the cornerstones of school life.
IRS990.Desc: Regular Education Program: The philosophy of The Thacher School is rooted in the wisdom and work of its founder, Sherman Day Thacher, who embraced the extraordinary natural venue of his school and sought above all else to train his students in the art of living for their own greatest good and for the good of their fellow citizens. He believed the most worthwhile education combined a vigorous academic life with rugged outdoor activities that engendered self-reliance, concern for others, and fidelity to four principles: honor, fairness, kindness, and truth.This year The Thacher School unveiled a newly transformed Observatory and with the expertise of staff will facilitate educational pathways in astronomy, computer science, robotics and engineering.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Sierra Wilderness Program: Golden Trout Camp is an integral part of wilderness and leadership training at Thacher. Additionally, GTC offers an educational experience for alumni and friends of The Thacher School. GTC is a throwback to an earlier time in the Sierra when hunting and fishing camps were common in the high country. Located at 10,200 feet, just south of one of the highest peaks in California, the camp offers access to one of the world's wildest ecosystems.The program also provided health, wellness and wilderness training for inner-city and disadvantaged youth during the summer months.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The School is exempt under IRC Sec. 501(c)(3) as a public charity due to the nature of its activities as an educational institution. Public Support Organizations described in IRC Sec. 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A) (ii)- Schools are public charities. Additionally, the School meets the public support test of IRC Sec 170(b)(1)(A)(vi).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowment funds are intended to further the educational mission of the school by providing for financial aid and support of faculty and facilities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part X : FIN48 Footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Since the School is exempt from Federal and State income tax liability, no provision is made for current or deferred income taxes. The School uses the same accounting methods for tax and financial reporting.The accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America provides accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its exempt tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by the School in its Federal and State exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. The School is subject to examinations by the U.S. Federal and State tax authorities from 2010 to present, generally for three years after they are filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Reclass financial aid and grants $2717179 Cost of goods sold $-29624

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cost of goods sold - student auxiliary $29624

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants and assistance to individuals $2717180 Cost of goods sold $0

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The school publishes annually the non-discrimination policy in Los Angeles Times. The school also makes all interested parties aware of its non-discrimination policy through catalogs, brochures, and other such means during the solicitation period.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Part I, Line 3f - Method of Accounting
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Investments are reported at fair market value consistent with U.S. GAAP

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 3f - Investments and Expenditures
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Investment of long term endowment funds are reported at fair market value at year end. Valuations fluctuate based on realized and unrealized gains and losses.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Additional Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In order to objectively establish financial need, The Thacher School subscribes to the services of the School Scholarship Service (SSS) which provides a financial aid need analysis based on information made available by families in a confidential Parent Financial Statement. By applying objective criteria in a specific formula, SSS is able to help establish a family's ability to pay the expected Parental Contribution, which is then adjusted for the number of other family members in tuition charging institutions and for day versus boarding situations. Once financial need has been established Thacher will make a financial aid award which comes as close as possible to meeting the indicated need.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Part VI
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Arbitrage rebate computations encompass the bond and investment activity from the closing date, January 4, 2010, through December 31,2015. Based on computations, no rebate liability exists and reporting to the IRS is not required.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Faculty and administrator spouses are hired in the normal course of business.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Parent Association chairs are a single voting member of the Board of Trustees related by marriage.A key employee is related by marriage to a highly compensated employeeA board member's company recieved payment for services in the ordinary course of business.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared internally and reviewed by the Director of Finance. An outside consultant prepared a top-level review. The full Form 990, except for Schedule B, is reviewed and approved by the audit committee prior to being presented to the full board of trustees through a secure website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Conflict of interest disclosure forms are signed by trustees annually. Identified conflicts are addressed by the Board President and Head of School as appropriate for the circumstances. An affected board member will recuse them self from any board action that may involve a conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: School hired an independent compensation consultant that compared the Head's compensation with that of a group of 28 other schools. The Head's compensation was set based on the information gathered. Subsequent years have been met with inflationary increases. Additionally, in each of those subsequent years comparative data from three dozen boarding schools has been utilized to validate adequacy and comparability.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees delegates duties to the Personnel Committee. The Personnel Committee is responsible for conducting annual performance and compensation review of the Head of School. The Personnel Committee also assists the Head of School with issues regarding faculty and administrator compensation. Salaries are compared to a peer group of schools who provide statistics through membership with the NAIS. The full board votes and determines the level of compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Financial statements, conflict of interest policy or governing documents are available to the public upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: The Thacher School Endowment LP
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Thacher School formed a fund of one investment partnership with Windhorse Capital Management and transferred all endowment funds to a Delaware Limited Liability Company. Windhorse Capital Management is the outsourced investment manager and transacts business on behalf the School.All but $72,253 of investment income is excluded under IRC Sections 512-514. The total net income from this investment partnership for the fiscal year ended 6/30/16 was $18,547,243. This includes capital gains/losses of $17,610,565 and professional, administrative and portfolio expenses of $770,804.
